abstract_summ: RESULTS: Predictions were done with 93.75% of accuracy for registered case models and 84.4% of accuracy for recovered case models.The logistic growth model, basic SEIR model and adjusted SEIR model were adopted for prediction.Given that different model inputs may infer different model outputs, we implemented three model predictions with three scenarios of epidemic development.Epidemic prediction results yielded by different mathematical models are inconsistent; therefore, we sought to compare different models and their prediction results to generate objective conclusions.The logistic growth model estimated a smaller epidemic size than the basic SERI model did; however, once we added parameters that considered the effects of public health interventions and control measures, the adjusted SERI model results demonstrated a considerably rapid deceleration of epidemic development.
title_summ: SEIR and Regression Model based COVID-19 outbreak predictions in IndiaForecasting the Worldwide Spread of COVID-19 based on Logistic Model and SEIR ModelShort-term Forecasting of Cumulative Confirmed Cases of Covid-19 Pandemic in SomaliaCoronavirus epidemic: prediction and controlling measuresChinese and Italian COVID-19 outbreaks can be correctly described by a modified SIRD modelCOVID-19 pandemic: a mobility-dependent SEIR model with undetected cases in Italy, Europe and USCOVID-19 virus outbreak forecasting of registered and recovered cases after sixty day lockdown in Italy: A data driven model approach
title_abstract_phrases: RESULTS: Predictions were done with 93.75% of accuracy for registered case models and 84.4% of accuracy for recovered case models.The logistic growth model, basic SEIR model and adjusted SEIR model were adopted for prediction.Given that different model inputs may infer different model outputs, we implemented three model predictions with three scenarios of epidemic development.Epidemic prediction results yielded by different mathematical models are inconsistent; therefore, we sought to compare different models and their prediction results to generate objective conclusions.COVID-19 pandemic: a mobility-dependent SEIR model with undetected cases in Italy, Europe and USBackground: The outbreak of Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) emerged in China at the end of 2019 and has spread worldwide within few weeks reaching a pandemic status.
